mdRecord.dcterms:title: Rosalie Mansion, interior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: View of living room with ornate carved chairs, fireplace and other furniture

...Rosalie Mansion was built for Peter Little, a wealthy cotton broker, in 1823 on the bluff overlooking the Mississippi River. It was designed by J. S. Griffin. On July 13, 1863 General Grant took possession of Rosalie to use as Union Army Headquarters. Rosalie Mansion has been owned, operated, and maintained as a historic house museum by the Mississippi State Society Daughters of the American Revolution, for over 70 years. It was declared a National Historic Landmark in 1989. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosalie_Mansion [work]
